books.title: Ben Hur
books.author: Lew Wallace
books.summary: A young Jewish man’s family is falsely imprisoned and he is sent to the galleys; when he is released, he swears revenge on the Romans.

books.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
books.author: Anthony Hope
books.summary: King Rudolph V of Ruritania is drugged and abducted on the eve of his coronation, and a gentleman on holiday who happens to look like the king has to stop the sinister plot.

books.title: Personal Memoirs of Ulysses S. Grant
books.author: Ulysses S. Grant
books.summary: One of the greatest generals of the United States tells the story of his life and details his key role in winning the Civil War.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: The Surprising Adventures of Baron Munchausen
books.author: Rudolph Erich Raspe
books.summary: The legendary Baron Munchausen’s tall tales of wonder and adventure.

books.title: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two best friends become involved in a love triangle.

books.title: The Gods of Pegāna
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A mysterious god creates a cosmic pantheon to rule over its worlds and time.

books.title: The Monster
books.author: Edgar Saltus
books.summary: Fleeing a terrible truth, a woman remarries, but her first husband comes back for answers.

books.title: At the Mountains of Madness
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: An Antarctic expedition reveals the horrifying reality of ancient myths in the depths of the continent.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Incredulity of Father Brown
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: The third set of stories of a Catholic priest who is also an amateur detective.

books.title: Twelve Years a Slave
books.author: Solomon Northup
books.summary: The account of a free black man kidnapped in 1841 and sold into slavery, from which it took twelve years to free himself.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: A collection of Thomas Paine’s essays on republicanism, the problems of monarchy, and human rights.

books.title: Nonsense Books
books.author: Edward Lear
books.summary: A collection of literary nonsense in the forms of limericks, songs, and short stories.

books.title: The Little Nugget
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: The ambitious fiancée of an English gentleman asks him to kidnap the son of an American businessman from boarding school, before professional kidnappers get to him first.

books.title: Omega
books.author: Camille Flammarion
books.summary: A comet threatens to collide with the Earth, perhaps bringing about the end of the world.

books.title: The Son of the Wolf
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A collection of stories entailing life during the gold rush in the harsh wilderness of northwestern North America.

books.title: Polynesian Mythology
books.author: George Grey
books.summary: A collection of Māori mythology covering the start of the universe through to the spread of Māori tribes through New Zealand’s North Island.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.
